name: Wright Flyer
description: The first successful powered aircraft, made the first controlled, sustained flight on December 17, 1903.

name: Curtiss JN-4 "Jenny"
description: Widely used as a trainer aircraft during WWI and later for barnstorming in the 1920s.

name: Fokker Dr.I
description: Iconic German fighter flown by the Red Baron, known for agility in dogfights.

name: Sopwith Camel
description: Deadly British fighter with twin machine guns; difficult but effective.
notes: More kills than any other Allied fighter

name: Spirit of St. Louis
description: Custom-built for Charles Lindbergh’s solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic.

name: Douglas DC-3
description: Revolutionary airliner that made passenger travel profitable; still flown today.

name: Supermarine Spitfire
description: Iconic British fighter of WWII with elliptical wings and superb maneuverability.
notes: Key role in Battle of Britain

name: Messerschmitt Bf 109
description: Luftwaffe’s primary fighter; fast, agile, and mass-produced.

name: Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress
description: Heavy bomber known for durability and long-range missions over Europe.

name: North American P-51 Mustang
description: Long-range escort fighter that dominated European skies.
notes: Escorted bombers to Berlin and back

name: de Havilland Mosquito
description: Wooden 'Wonder' used as bomber, fighter, and reconnaissance plane.

name: Mitsubishi A6M Zero
description: Highly maneuverable Japanese naval fighter with extreme range.

name: Avro Lancaster
description: British heavy bomber famous for Dambuster raids and precision night bombing.

name: Bell X-1
description: First aircraft to break the sound barrier in level flight, piloted by Chuck Yeager.

name: Boeing 707
description: First successful commercial jet airliner, ushered in the Jet Age for passengers.

name: Concorde
description: World’s first supersonic passenger jet; flew London to New York in under 3.5 hours.

name: Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird
description: High-altitude, long-range reconnaissance aircraft; fastest air-breathing manned aircraft.

name: Boeing 747
description: The 'Jumbo Jet' — first wide-body airliner with upper deck.

name: McDonnell Douglas F-15 Eagle
description: Undefeated in air-to-air combat; twin-engine tactical fighter.

name: Grumman F-14 Tomcat
description: Variable-sweep wing carrier-based fighter with Phoenix missiles.

name: Airbus A380
description: World’s largest passenger airliner with double-deck cabin layout.

name: F-22 Raptor
description: Air superiority fighter with supercruise and stealth.

name: F-35 Lightning II
description: Stealth multirole combat aircraft with advanced sensors and vertical takeoff capability (B variant).

name: Boeing 787 Dreamliner
description: Fuel-efficient composite-body jetliner with advanced aerodynamics and passenger comfort.

name: Joby eVTOL
description: Prototype all-electric vertical takeoff and landing air taxi for urban mobility.
notes: Represents the rise of electric air taxis

name: Lilium Jet
description: All-electric jet with 36 ducted fans for vertical and horizontal flight.
